alert.note: Alert for Marion; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MARION AND SOUTHERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 834 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springfield. The storm was drifting southward. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Springfield, Loretto, Bradfordsville, Raywick, Burkes Spring, Belltown, Rineltown, Bearwallow and Briartown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
